item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 22, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We use our own hardware at Fastmail (235 points | 63 comments)
2. Feed readers which don't take "no" for an answer (29 points | 20 comments)
3. The essays of Michel de Montaigne online (106 points | 22 comments)
4. Slow deployment causes meetings (2015) (124 points | 43 comments)
5. Murder Mystery: GCC Builds Failing After Sbuild Refactoring (51 points | 8 comments)
6. City Roads: A tool to draw all roads in a city at once (324 points | 46 comments)
7. We saved battery in our ESP32 WiFi circuits (TCP vs UDP) (37 points | 16 comments)
8. The legacy of NeXT lives on in OS X (2012) (45 points | 47 comments)
9. A data table thousands of years old (2020) (203 points | 88 comments)
10. More than 140 Kenya Facebook moderators sue after diagnoses of PTSD (218 points | 184 comments)
11. Query Apple's FindMy network with Python (419 points | 163 comments)
12. Translating 10M lines of Java to Kotlin (117 points | 117 comments)
13. How we made our AI code review bot stop leaving nitpicky comments (168 points | 115 comments)
14. Ideas from "A Philosophy of Software Design" (152 points | 82 comments)
15. 'AI-powered judge' takes boxing closer to brave new world it appears to seek (3 points | discuss)
16. Enum of Arrays (107 points | 34 comments)
17. One Surprising Psychosis Treatment That Works: Learning to Live with the Voices (29 points | 25 comments)
18. The distribution of eigenvalues of GUE and its minors at fixed index (9 points | 1 comment)
19. GPT-5 is behind schedule (46 points | 41 comments)
20. Rosetta 2 creator leaves Apple to work on Lean full-time (249 points | 77 comments)
21. Keeping a Changelog at Work (2020) (108 points | 39 comments)
22. JEP 483: Ahead-of-Time Class Loading and Linking (101 points | 26 comments)
23. Introducing S2 (311 points | 154 comments)
24. Dividing unsigned 8-bit numbers (138 points | 58 comments)
25. Ask HN: How do you improve your writing? (13 points | 18 comments)
26. Show HN: Eonfall – A new third-person co-op action game built for the web (186 points | 116 comments)
27. MacKenzie Scott donates over $2B in 2024 to 199 organizations (61 points | 41 comments)
28. Show HN: Demo of my web game about social persuasion (105 points | 42 comments)
29. Fault Report – and alternative to Result in F# (40 points | 14 comments)
30. Talking over a wall changed my direction as a programmer (116 points | 49 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 22, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
